Generation IV.Diamond: There is a long-held belief that medicine made from its scales will heal even incurable illnesses.
Generation IV.Pearl: It habitually digs up and hoards gems in its nest. Its loot is constantly targeted by thieves.
Generation IV.Platinum: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
Generation IV.HeartGold: As it digs to expand its nest, it habitually digs up gems that it then hoards in its nest.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: As it digs to expand its nest, it habitually digs up gems that it then hoards in its nest.

Generation V.Black: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
Generation V.White: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
Generation V.Black 2: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
Generation V.White 2: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.

Generation VI.X: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
Generation VI.Y: As it digs to expand its nest, it habitually digs up gems that it then hoards in its nest.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: As it digs to expand its nest, it habitually digs up gems that it then hoards in its nest.

Generation VII.Sun: In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales. Medicine containing its scales as an ingredient will make a weary body feel invigorated.
Generation VII.Moon: Shiny objects are its passion. It can be found in its cave, scarcely moving, its gaze fixed on the jewels it's amassed or Carbink it has caught.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It loves shiny things. When it finds a Sableye trying to catch a Carbink, Gabite becomes furiously angry and attacks the Sableye.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It sheds its skin and gradually grows larger. Its scales can be ground into a powder and used as raw materials for traditional medicine.

Generation VIII.Sword: This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from a protrusion on either side of its head to probe pitch-dark caves.
Generation VIII.Shield: Jewels are buried in the caves these Pokémon nest in, but you'll be torn apart by claws and fangs the moment you enter one of these caves.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: There is a long-held belief that medicine made from its scales will heal incurable illnesses.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It habitually digs up and hoards gems in its nest. Its loot is constantly targeted by thieves.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Though Gabite are usually of a violent disposition, when I gave one a glass bead it had been eyeing covetously, it suddenly became quite docile.

Generation IX.Scarlet: In rare cases, it molts and sheds its scales. Medicine containing its scales as an ingredient will make a weary body feel invigorated.
Generation IX.Violet: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.

Generation VIII.Shield Expansion Pass: Giant's Bed , Path to the Peak , Ballimere Lake , Three-Point Pass , Frigid Sea ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Grand Underground - Riverbank Cave , Fountainspring Cave , Still-Water Cavern (After obtaining TM99 ( Waterfall ))
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Grand Underground - Riverbank Cave , Fountainspring Cave , Still-Water Cavern (After obtaining TM99 ( Waterfall ))
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Coronet Highlands : near Clamberclaw Cliffs , Clamberclaw Cliffs ( mass outbreaks ), massive mass outbreaks Alabaster Icelands : Avalanche Slopes

Generation IX.Scarlet: South Province: Area Six , Alfornada Cavern West Province: Area Two North Province: Area Two , Dalizapa Passage , Glaseado Mountain Area Zero Tera Raid Battles ( 4★ )
Generation IX.Violet: South Province: Area Six , Alfornada Cavern West Province: Area Two North Province: Area Two , Dalizapa Passage , Glaseado Mountain Area Zero Tera Raid Battles ( 4★ )
